alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 2:56PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FREEZING RAIN/DRIZZLE POSSIBLE AFTER MIDNIGHT INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS OF WEDNESDAY... Rain will overspread the region around or shortly after midnight, and continue into Wednesday morning. At the onset, surface temperatures will be near or slightly below freezing across northern and western Hartford county, extending north into Hampshire and Hampden counties of MA. This includes the cities and towns of Hartford, Windsor Locks, Amherst, Northampton, and Springfield. Therefore, rain may freeze on contact, resulting in icy spots, especially any untreated surfaces including sidewalks, overpasses, bridges, exit and entrance ramps. Temperatures should warm above freezing after 8 AM Wednesday, reducing the threat for slippery travel.
